text: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/julia-user-developer-survey-2021/58927> Is this legit? The user has only 1 prior post on discourse and it seem weird that one needs to request access.

attachments.title: Julia User & Developer Survey 2021
attachments.text: It’s time to conduct the third annual Julia User & Developer survey. Before we invite Julia users and developers to complete the survey, we invite you to review the survey questions and share any feedback you may have. The link is available here: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MgEcQ9VMZuYM1lx3QkALh9iHdEVq_YJt_tb7YmR5-NI/edit?usp=sharing> Once you are approved and have access to the survey, please insert comments directly in the Google doc. Thank you!

elements.text: Is this legit? The user has only 1 prior post on discourse and it seem weird that one needs to request access.

text: given he's the director of marketing and communications of :juliacomputing:  and the survey is run by :juliacomputing:  I'd assume so: <https://juliacomputing.com/about-us/>

text: Alright :relaxed: Interesting that the director of marketing and communication has only two total discourse posts :smile:

elements.text: Alright
Interesting that the director of marketing and communication has only two total discourse posts

text: ah, it's that time of year again

elements.text: ah, it's that time of year again

text: I wonder what the most requested feature/improvement will be this year around

elements.text: I wonder what the most requested feature/improvement will be this year around
MOAR SPEED
that always anyways :p

text: I'm (not so) secretely hoping for static compilation and/or atomics/memory semantics

elements.text: I'm (not so) secretely hoping for static compilation and/or atomics/memory semantics

text: I think <https://github.com/tshort/StaticCompiler.jl> working somewhat reliably can be even more impactful than PackageCompiler

elements.text: I think
working somewhat reliably can be even more impactful than PackageCompiler
very much agreed

text: using Revise during development and StaticCompiler in a build/deploy step will be magnificent

elements.text: using Revise during development and StaticCompiler in a build/deploy step will be magnificent

text: yes, and it could greatly increase adoption outside of julia: you can effectively distribute binaries without julia runtime

elements.text: yes, and it could greatly increase adoption outside of julia: you can effectively distribute binaries without julia runtime

text: you'd have to restrict types that can be used but hey, that's what people out there expect anyway :smile:
